snippet: Problems in the election system extend beyond isolated voting issues in a few locations, according to a study from the Pew Charitable Trusts.
abstract: Major study issued by the Pew Charitable Trusts finds deep and widespread flaws in the American election system; study ranks all 50 states based on more than 15 criteria, providing a detailed portrait of dysfunction and disenfranchisement.
lead_paragraph: Problems in the election system extend beyond isolated voting issues in a few locations, according to a study from the Pew Charitable Trusts.

headline.seo: U.S. Voting Flaws Are Widespread, Study Shows
headline.main: Lost Votes, Problem Ballots, Long Waits? Flaws Are Widespread, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Lost Votes, Problem Ballots, Long Waits? Flaws Are Widespread, Study Finds
